div.p: No. 1467, pp. 932-3, unit 42, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

MS annotation in the letter book: ‘Circulars similar to that on page 932 [i.e. the original letter in this series, which was addressed to the Secretary of the Law Department] to the following'. The list included 'The Government Botanist'. (Circular)

I have the honor, by direction of the Chief Secretary, to intimate to you that it is the desire of the Government that all departmental reports for 1875, intended to be laid before Parliament, may be completed in time for presentation on the first day of its re-assembling.
